div.head: Excerpta traduzione
div.p: ξη. What concerns places in which they worship god. ⌠temples, churches, altars, sanctuaries, oratories, shrines of prophets, shrines of martyrs, προσευχαί (‘places of prayer’) as Philo says⌡ ‘sacred enclosures’, ‘precints’ (τεμένη), ⌠as if they were cut off (τέμνω) to honor the god⌡ ‘sacred’ places are ‘consecrated’, ‘hallowed’, ‘let free to a god’,⌠‘house of prayer’, ‘holy places’, ‘udefiled’,⌡ ‘inviolable’, ‘ not to be trodden’, ‘untouchable’, ‘untouched’, ‘secret’, ⌠‘unaccessible’, ‘untrodden’.⌡ The land [could be said] holy and let free for a god. The places nearby are ‘holy’ ‘enclosures’, ‘safe places’, ‘boundaries’, ‘propylaia’, ‘vestibules’, ‘prodomoi’, ‘opisthodomoi’, ‘entrances’, ‘porches’.

ξθ. What the heathens say on temples. ‘altar’, ‘censer’, ‘hestia, ‘vessels for fumigation’, ‘pouring-cups’, ‘vessels for lustral water’, ‘ purificatory offerings’, ‘purificatory sacrifices’. ⌠Groves, springs, bowls, craters, Styx’s water, instrument of purification, on which they sacrifice live victims, and slay a victim, and burn incense, and besprinkle the dead, and offer sacrifices to the daemons or to the gods through the purifiers, namely their priests.⌡

ο. What concerns pagans’ objects of worship. ‘Statues (ἀγάλματα)’, ‘xoana’, ‘statues (ἕδη) of gods’, βρέτη (‘wooden images’), ‘images of gods’,⌠‘likenesses’,⌡ ‘representations’, ⌠‘shapes’,⌡‘figures’, ⌠‘offences’, ‘abomination’, ‘made by hand’, ‘work of bronze’, ‘idols’, ‘made in gold’, ‘images of men’, ‘block of stones’, ‘statues (καθιδρύματα)’,⌡ ‘raffigurations’, ‘figures’, ⌠‘engravings’, ‘busts’, ‘appearances’. You will call the heathens’ gods ‘all-suffering’, and ‘crowd’, and ‘polyarchy of gods’.
